summary.name: Vinyl Record by Nicole Yagar
summary.description: The vinyl record I have chosen is Fine Line by Harry Styles, the 2019 press and black (standard) version.

overview.name: Lacquer
overview.description: "Lacquers are the physical bridge between recorded sound and the finished record. As the medium onto which music is transferred, and from which stampers are created, master discs or lacquers represent a crucial part of the vinyl manufacturing process." The company Public Records offers a range of services, including lacquers. They detail the manufacturing process, their distributors, their handling size, along with the general process for how lacquers are made and utilized during the vinyl record creation process. Their primary office is located in Japan, but they have (distributor) services/offices in the U.K., USA, Germany, and across Japan.

location.address:
3415-1, Machi
Miyada, Kamiina-Gun, Nagano
Japan 399-4301 - Public Record Company

overview.name: Aluminum
overview.description: Aluminum is involved in the creation of vinyl records because the master disc (also known as the lacquer master), is made up of aluminum and is subsequently covered in a coat of lacquer. Aluminum may be used as it is lightweight, durable, and one of the "most commonly produced metals in the world…Aluminum's flexibility and electrically conductive properties give it an advantage in electronics industries, while its recyclability makes it popular for use in making food-safe foils and cans." The companies Alcoa, Century Aluminum, and Magnitude 7 Metals, are just a few examples of the top producers of aluminum in the U.S. “These companies have six aluminum smelters in the United States.” While it is difficult to determine the exact source(s) for a given vinyl record master, these aluminum locations are a potential source, but not confirmed.

location.address:
201 Isabella Street, Suite 500
Pittsburgh, PA 15212-5858 - Alcoa

location.address:
391 St Jude Industrial Park Hwy
Portageville, MO  63873
United States - Magnitude 7 Metals

overview.name: Sapphire
overview.description: Sapphire connects and ties back into the creation of vinyl records because the stylus that is featured in a record player, for vinyl records, is typically made of sapphire given its durability. Diamonds can also be used, but sapphires are more commonly used. “Sapphire mines exist in many places across the globe. Many of the gems come from Asia, where stones are found in the mines of Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Thailand, Afghanistan, and other countries. Mines can also be found in Australia and the African nations of Tanzania, Kenya, Nigeria, and Madagascar. In the U.S., sapphire miners head for Montana.” While it is difficult to determine the exact source(s) for a given vinyl record master, these sapphire locations are a potential source, but not confirmed.

location.address:
21 Sapphire Gulch Ln
Philipsburg, MT  59858
United States - Gem Mountain Sapphire Mine

overview.name: Helium
overview.description: In the creation of vinyl records, helium is mainly utilized during the cutting process, where the stylus becomes cooled with helium gas in order to avoid any kind of fire or other subsequent hazards that could result from the process. “Helium is a non-renewable natural resource that is most commonly recovered from natural gas deposits. Geologic conditions in Texas, Oklahoma, and Kansas make the natural gas in these areas some of the most helium-rich in the world.” Two of the helium plants in those respective states include Jayhawk Helium Plant in Kansas, and Amarillo Helium Plant in Texas. While it is difficult to determine the exact source(s) for a given vinyl record master, these helium locations are a potential source, but not confirmed.

location.address:
13139 US-160
Ulysses, KS 67880 - Jayhawk Helium Plant (operated by Praxair)

overview.name: Helium
overview.description: In the creation of vinyl records, helium is mainly utilized during the cutting process, where the stylus becomes cooled with helium gas in order to avoid any kind of fire or other subsequent hazards that could result from the process. “Helium is a non-renewable natural resource that is most commonly recovered from natural gas deposits. Geologic conditions in Texas, Oklahoma, and Kansas make the natural gas in these areas some of the most helium-rich in the world.” Two of the helium plants in those respective states include Jayhawk Helium Plant in Kansas, and Amarillo Helium Plant in Texas. While it is difficult to determine the exact source(s) for a given vinyl record master, these helium locations are a potential source, but not confirmed.

location.address: Amarillo Helium Plant, Texas

overview.name: Polyvinyl Chloride
overview.description: Pellets of polyvinyl chloride are involved in the creation of vinyl records because it’s inexpensive, lightweight, and can be used as a replacement or alternative for metal. In the case of colored vinyls, the pellets used would instead have the respective colors needed for the desired outcome (i.e. blue, yellow, red). “Nowadays, with the stylus back in style, the ingredients of LPs are manufactured offshore. More than half of the polyvinyl chloride (PVC) used by today’s US record manufacturers comes from the Thai Plastic and Chemicals Public Company Limited (TPC), which has its headquarters in Bangkok.”

location.address: 1 Siam Cement Road Bangsue Bangkok 10800 Thailand - Thai Plastic and Chemicals Public Company Limited

overview.name: Silver
overview.description: In the creation of vinyl records, the master disc is sprayed with silver because the silver helps to strengthen the disc against any pressure that can result from replication. There are silver mines all over the world, but some of the larger silver mines being located in countries such as Mexico, Poland, Australia, Bolivia, Turkey, and Peru. Hecla, Coeur Mining, and Pan American Silver are a few examples of mining companies that can be viewed as “primary silver miners.” While it is difficult to determine the exact source(s) for a given vinyl record master, these silver mine locations are a potential source, but not confirmed.

location.address: 98230 Mazapil, ZAC - Penasquito, Mexico Mine

overview.name: Nickel
overview.description: One of the stages in the making of the stamper disc involves a nickel bath, followed by the disc being electroplated. Regarding where nickel can be found, “Nickel typically occurs naturally in an impure form as ore. It must be mined, extracted and refined. It is mined in a couple of dozen countries around the world, the most prolific of which include Russia, Australia, Indonesia, and Canada. Back to the “appearance” of nickel, there are some who think that the large deposit of nickel in the Sudbury region of Canada is the result of an ancient meteor collision.” While it is difficult to determine the exact source for a given vinyl record master, this nickel location is a potential source, but not confirmed.

location.address:
Creighton Mine Rd
Lively ON - Sudbury region, Canada Mine

overview.name: Electroplating
overview.description: Electoplating relates back to the creation of vinyl records as it helps the nickel fill the grooves on the disc. "Electroplating lets you combine the strength, electrical conductivity, abrasion and corrosion resistance, and appearance of certain metals with different materials that boast their own benefits, such as affordable and/or lightweight metals or plastics…Electroplating is an effective way to add cosmetic metal finishes to customer products, sculptures, figurines, and art pieces.” United Record Pressing is an example of a company that deals with and handles electroplating for vinyl records.

location.address: 453 Allied Drive, Nashville TN 37211 - United Record Pressing

overview.name: Vinyl Stamper
overview.description: "An unformed stamper is the result of the electroforming process after either of the technologies (DMM or lacquer) implemented. After the stamper is produced, it is necessary to prepare it for the pressing machines. The stampers still need to be formed and trimmed in order to fit the pressing moulds on the record pressing machines." NiPro Records is an example of a company that offers vinyl record stampers as one of its specific services. They also offer different kinds of stamper forming types, including stamper centering, trimming, and a crimping and coining station.

location.address: 7 Marconi, Irvine, CA 92618, USA - NiPro Records, Precision Metal Mastering

overview.name: Hydraulic Press
overview.description: The hydraulic press is used in the creation of vinyl records mainly during the pressing stage, as it helps imprint the ridges which then create the grooves in the vinyl, which ultimately is what allows the vinyl to be playable. "The popular use of hydraulic presses in manufacturing is due to their ability to apply substantial compressive force to billets to flatten, shape, straighten, stamp, and bend the billets into designs and various forms." Macrodyne Hydraulic Presses & Automation, Grimco Presses Inc., and Savage Engineering and Sales are three examples of primary leading companies that offer and sell hydraulic presses.

location.address: 311 Connie Crescent, Concord, Ontario L4K 5R2 Canada - Macrodyne Hydraulic Presses & Automation

overview.name: Hydraulic Press
overview.description: The hydraulic press is used in the creation of vinyl records mainly during the pressing stage, as it helps imprint the ridges which then create the grooves in the vinyl, which ultimately is what allows the vinyl to be playable. "The popular use of hydraulic presses in manufacturing is due to their ability to apply substantial compressive force to billets to flatten, shape, straighten, stamp, and bend the billets into designs and various forms." Macrodyne Hydraulic Presses & Automation, Grimco Presses Inc., and Savage Engineering and Sales are three examples of primary leading companies that offer and sell hydraulic presses.

location.address: 65 1st Ave, Paterson, NJ 07514 - Grimco Presses Inc.

overview.name: Hydraulic Press
overview.description: The hydraulic press is used in the creation of vinyl records mainly during the pressing stage, as it helps imprint the ridges which then create the grooves in the vinyl, which ultimately is what allows the vinyl to be playable. "The popular use of hydraulic presses in manufacturing is due to their ability to apply substantial compressive force to billets to flatten, shape, straighten, stamp, and bend the billets into designs and various forms." Macrodyne Hydraulic Presses & Automation, Grimco Presses Inc., and Savage Engineering and Sales are three examples of primary leading companies that offer and sell hydraulic presses.

location.address: 4855 Chaincraft Rd, Cleveland, OH 44125 - Savage Engineering and Sales, Inc.

overview.name: Shrink Wrap Machine
overview.description: Shrink wrap machines are used in the creation of vinyl records because they are part of the end process when the vinyl is getting ready to be distributed. The records get wrapped in the plastic (also known as an album's jacket) provided by the machine, and afterwards is when the records are ready to be sent out. “Shrink wrap is applied to tightly fit a product using a heat source that shrinks the wrap to the particular dimensions of the product it’s covering. The source of heat is either generated from a hand held heat gun or through a shrink tunnel.” Douglas Machine is an example of a company that offers shrink wrap machines, which ultimately are then used for vinyl records.

location.address: 1705 34th Ave W, Alexandria, MN 56308 USA - Douglas Machine

overview.name: Label
overview.description: "The record labels that go in the center of each side also get loaded between the biscuit and the stamper on each side. Technicians have to bake the labels in advance to get all the moisture out of them, so they don’t bubble when pressed onto the vinyl by the machine." Tullis Russell is an example of a leading company that offers (record) labels for vinyl records, which then are placed between the biscuit and stamper, which is then followed by the pressing sequence where the biscuit and label are pressed together with heat and pressure.

location.address: Church Street, Bollington, Macclesfield, Cheshire SK10 5QF United Kingdom - Tullis Russell

overview.name: Jacket
overview.description: "Most record jackets manufactured before the 1980s were tip-ons but direct-to-board has since become the norm. As Freund explains, "if you go to old record stores, you'll see that [tip-ons] have trouble keeping them together. It's really just one piece of paper wrapping around and with the vinyl inside, it creates tension. The direct-to-board is a faster process and a less expensive process.'" Dorado Music Packaging is an example of a company that offers services specifically for the jacket involved with vinyl records.

location.address: 10742 Burbank Blvd. North Hollywood, CA 91601-2516 - Dorado Music Packaging

overview.name: Paper
overview.description: "The use of paper provided a sense of structure for the inner sleeve. Paper-based inners were able to better retain their shape as they were pushed into and pulled out of the outer sleeve…​​The main reason paper was used as the basis for the inner sleeve was down to marketing. Labels realised that the space it provided could be used to promote the label’s other vinyl releases or even the good care of the vinyl record itself, sometimes promoting specific vinyl care products or even stylii in the process.” Dutch Vinyl and Microforum are two examples of companies that offer inner sleeves, specifically paper sleeves, for vinyl records.

location.address: 179 Latrobe Terrace, 4064, Paddington, Queensland (Brisbane store) - Dutch Vinyl

overview.name: Paper
overview.description: "The use of paper provided a sense of structure for the inner sleeve. Paper-based inners were able to better retain their shape as they were pushed into and pulled out of the outer sleeve…​​The main reason paper was used as the basis for the inner sleeve was down to marketing. Labels realised that the space it provided could be used to promote the label’s other vinyl releases or even the good care of the vinyl record itself, sometimes promoting specific vinyl care products or even stylii in the process.” Dutch Vinyl and Microforum are two examples of companies that offer inner sleeves, specifically paper sleeves, for vinyl records.

location.address: 1 Woodborough Ave, York, ON M6M 5A1, Canada - Microforum

overview.name: Die Cutting Machine
overview.description: "All the sleeves are diecut where the card stock is cut into the required shape by an automated machine then proceed to being folded and glued to become the future home for your precious records. ​​The records are then packaged, shrink wrapped and sent to the artist or label for distribution.” Joraco Press Company and Eureka Machinery are two examples of companies that offer and provide die-cutting machines that are used in the creation of vinyl records. As the die-cutting machines cut the jackets for vinyl records into its proper shape, and often are done in bulk.

location.address:
Automated Industrial Machine, Inc.
347 Farnum Pike
Smithfield, RI 02917 USA - Joraco Press Company

overview.name: Glue Machine
overview.description: "A gluing machine is a piece of equipment used to apply adhesive to materials or products in a manufacturing or processing setting. This machine is designed to accurately and efficiently apply adhesive to surfaces such as paper, cardboard, or other materials, often in a precise and consistent manner…it greatly improves efficiency and productivity in the manufacturing process. By automating the gluing process, companies can produce a large volume of products in a shorter amount of time. Additionally, using a gluing machine ensures consistency and accuracy in the application of adhesive, reducing the likelihood of errors and waste.” Eureka Machinery is an example of a company that, along with die-cutting machines, also provides and offers other services such as a gluing machine.

location.address:
RM.1701/1727 TIMES MANSION,
SHANXI RD.(N) 200060 SHANGHAI CHINA - Eureka Machinery

overview.name: Vinyl Distribution
overview.description: "You will be pressing these for 2 purposes: as a test pressing to see if any pre-mastering/mastering changes need to be made, and to send out to distributors and as promos…You will need 1 or 2 (some distributors want 2) records for every distributor you send a demo to, plus some for promo purposes." Disc Makers, Tunecore, CD Baby, and Base for Music are all examples of companies that assist and offer vinyl distribution services. Many of these companies also are a streamline for artists to send out their music digitally to distributors and as promos, but they all do offer physical services in terms of physical, vinyl distribution.

location.address: 7905 N. Crescent Blvd, Pennsauken, NJ 08110 - Disc Makers

location.address: 148 rue du Faubourg Poissonnière 75010 Paris, France - Base for Music

overview.name: Independent Record Store - Retail Distribution
overview.description: "Distributors and record labels work closely to ensure the upcoming release has the best chance to succeed. This means starting the planning process several months in advance. Distributors like to be looped in as early as 6-8 months in advance, and may require a copy of the digital album 3-4 months ahead of release day…Engaging with your local record store can be a great way to start your physical distribution journey. Additionally, you could also engage with your artists’ local record stores, if they are from a different part of the country than you." Roughtrade is just one example, amongst a plentiful of others, of a business that offers and sells vinyl records, with more of an emphasis on in-person retail distribution for vinyl records, specifically Fine Line by Harry Styles. In comparison to other stores however, Roughtrade is an independent record store and for up-and-coming artists, Roughtrade may be an example of a company that they should visit first for retail distribution of their vinyls to then garner more traction. In the case of an artist such as Harry Styles however, who already accumulates a hefty number of listeners, the success of the physical distribution journey of Fine Line may not depend solely on a record store, and may find that it has success at being purchased; regardless if it is solely online or in-person.

location.address: 1250 6th Ave, New York, NY 10112 - Roughtrade

overview.name: Independent Record Store - Retail Distribution
overview.description: "We specialise in LPs & CDs, in all genres, including Rock & Roll, Classical & Jazz. We also sell Performing Arts Books & Scores, VHS tapes, DVDs, fiction paperbacks, mysteries & plays, as well as books on ballet, film, classical music, rock & roll, soul, jazz & opera, composer bios and theatre." Westsider Records is an example of an independent record store that offers retail distribution for vinyl records. Though Fine Line may not be sold at this store, Westsider Records is still an example of a local record store that artists can go to first if they are interested in having their music be sold in-person via retail distribution.

location.address: 233 W 72nd St, New York, NY 10023 - Westsider Records

overview.name: Corporation - Retail Distribution
overview.description: Another example of a business that offers both online and in-person retail distribution for Fine Line is Barnes & Noble. As opposed to Roughtrade, which is an independent record store, Barnes & Noble is a corporation that has stores all over the United States. "Barnes & Noble is the world’s largest retail bookseller and a leading retailer of content, digital media and educational products. The Company operates approximately 600 Barnes & Noble bookstores across the United States." Given the number of stores Barnes & Noble has all over the country, along with its online retail distribution, it greatly increases the outlet and accessibiltiy for Fine Line to be purchased by consumers; both in the United States, and outside as well.

location.address: 555 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10017 - Barnes & Noble

overview.name: Corporation - Retail Distribution
overview.description: Another example of a business that offers both online and in-person retail distribution for Fine Line is Best Buy. Best Buy offers a range of products centering around technology and electronics, and one of the products they offer are vinyl records, including Fine Line. What differs Best Buy from the independent record stores and from the other chain company Barnes & Noble is that Best Buy is much more aligned with technology, electronics, and media, not necessarily with books or vintage items, though the commonality they all share is that they all sell vinyl records.

location.address: 60 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10010 - Best Buy

overview.name: Record Pressing
overview.description: “The warm, interactive vinyl experience has come back into the spotlight as the preferred method of music listening for many consumers today. Memphis Record Pressing began in response to the increasing demand for vinyl record production. We press high quality records that undergo a strict inspection process to ensure the consumer is 100% satisfied with the finished product. Currently, MRP offers 12” formatted records in weights of 140 and 180 grams.” According to Discogs, Memphis Record Pressing is the company where the vinyl Fine Line, by Harry Styles, (2019 press, black standard vinyl) was pressed at.

location.address:
3015 Brother Boulevard
Memphis, Tennessee, USA 38133 - Memphis Record Pressing

overview.name: Vinyl Mastering
overview.description: According to Discogs, GZ Media is the company where the vinyl record Fine Line, by Harry Styles (2019 press and black standard vinyl) was mastered at. “GZ Media is the world’s largest producer of vinyl records and one of the most complete print & packaging companies in Europe.” They offer a variety of different formats for vinyl records, including 12", 10", and 7". “Before choosing the format of the record, you must take the total playback time and physical principles of playback into consideration. According to this, the worst suitable format is the 7“ cut at 33 1/3 RPM. (which we don’t recommend, because this format has the lowest circumference speed during playback in the center area of the record). For the best quality sound GZ recommends 12” black vinyl with 45RPM.”

location.address:
GZ Media, a.s. Tovární 340
267 12 Loděnice, Czech Republic - GZ Media

overview.name: Vinyl Mastering
overview.description: According to Discogs, another company where the vinyl record Fine Line, by Harry Styles (2019 press and black standard vinyl) was mastered at is Sterling Sound. Sterling Sound has two offices, one in Edgewater, New Jersey and the other in Nashville, Tennessee. The process of vinyl mastering involves “checking of the supplied audio master, making minor changes (if necessary) to the final version to ensure that it is suitable for the cutting and production of vinyl records and the final transcribing of the prepared audio onto a physical carrier by cutting the grooves into the master plates via DMM, or, in special cases, lacquer technology.”

location.address:
33 Hilliard Avenue
Edgewater, NJ 07020, USA - Sterling Sound Edgewater

overview.name: Vinyl Mastering
overview.description: According to Discogs, another company where the vinyl record Fine Line, by Harry Styles (2019 press and black standard vinyl) was mastered at is Sterling Sound. Sterling Sound has two offices, one in Edgewater, New Jersey and the other in Nashville, Tennessee. The process of vinyl mastering involves “checking of the supplied audio master, making minor changes (if necessary) to the final version to ensure that it is suitable for the cutting and production of vinyl records and the final transcribing of the prepared audio onto a physical carrier by cutting the grooves into the master plates via DMM, or, in special cases, lacquer technology.”

location.address:
805 Meridian Street
Nashville, TN, USA - Sterling Sound Nashville
